channel.title: Empty Command - Please i need help
channel.description: how do i add the empty command?...

item.title: Empty Command - Please i need help
item.dc:creator: @mrpyro3 mrpyro3
item.description:
@mrpyro3 wrote:

The empty command given above is for delta. Try this:
if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“empty”)) {
c.getPA().deleteAllItems();
c.sendMessage(“You empty your invatory”);
}
or:
if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“empty”)) {
c.getItems().deleteAllItems();
c.sendMessage(“You empty your invatory”);
}

Read full topic
item.source: Empty Command - Please i need help

item.title: Empty Command - Please i need help
item.dc:creator: @anthonyduka anthonyduka
item.description:
@anthonyduka wrote:

JavaCoderV2:

Where do i put it though? i have no commands… and i don’t know… lol

Go into your Server folder then src, server, model, players, packets, commands.java

and place that code, right where the other ones are.

@ Mista pnut, are you using Project Insanity? I just tried that but it gave me 5 errors

item.title: Empty Command - Please i need help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Cycle through all the items in the players Inventory, replace it with a blank Item, refresh the items on screen.

Read full topic
item.source: Empty Command - Please i need help

item.title: Empty Command - Please i need help
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

if (command.startsWith("empty")) { long now = System.currentTimeMillis(); if (now - lastAction < 60000) { sM("You must wait 60 seconds after an action to ::empty!"); lastAction = now; } else { removeAllItems(); } }

That’s mine. Add it to your command in client.java

Read full topic
